subject: Document README for pldmtool.
commitMessage:

Resolves openbmc/pldm/issues/#20

i used clang format ... it auto corrected the space i guess :)
clang-format should not work on README files. and we are not supposed to run clang-format on these files.

+1

And also, can you push this to the bottom of this file ?
I put this here because it is comes under code organization section
please also link the pldm spec files URL with all of these.
i dont think it is required
It would be nice if you link the DSP Spec files URLs into these, so that people can know fru - mean which spec to refer for framing the pldmtool commands
I will mention at the ending

Do you mean `Libraries` is `libpldm`?

If so, libpldm is implemented in C, and `libpldmresponder` is implemented in C++
no i mean about the pldm_base_cmd.cpp .... etc file ...
These are object files not libraries right ?

and also the heading seems to be covering a broader scope..please modify that.

`Code Organization` ?
These are libraries ? or object files ?
respective to the PLDM type or with respect to the PLDM type
hmm i think library ?? some suggest me here
why dont you use markdown highlighting for italic here ? rather than quotes
this copied as displayed in the help text
oh, then tool is having a grammar mistake :)

Do you also think, adding a section cheatsheet - that gives the example commands to : will help ?
1. Set the Effecter.
2. Get Effecter Value
3. Get Statesensor Value
4. Send a platformEvent Message.
yes we can do that.. separately something like this https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/REDFISH-cheatsheet.md for pldmtool also
Sure feel free to add it as another commit on top of this.
let this commit go in .. i will think about cheatsheet in next commit

Please add 

```
Resolves #20 
```
https://github.com/openbmc/pldm/issues/20

so that the issue will be close automatically once this commit is merged.
should we call it as object or source files ? initially i named it as libraries
This needs to be expanded so that the user can test the capabilities of a PLDM daemon running on OpenBMC.

Like how? 

- communicates with pldm daemon running on BMC
- Enables writing functional test cases for PLDM stack

first we do encode request and later decode response right?
can u please suggest me on rephrasing
How is pldmtool related to libpldmresponder?
we need handlers implemented in pldm/libpldmresponder just that encode/decode in pldm/libpldm is not enough for pldmtool to work right ?
Please add an example with this option, to help user understand. Basically two examples, one to target PLDM daemon on OpenBMC and other to target a remote MCTP endpoint.
These references can change on the next version of the specification. I guess not needed here or probably point to the DMTF landing page.
Please add an example for the JSON output vs printing the output.

By default we are displaying pldmtool output in JSON format. so i think there is no need of mentioning example for  'printing the output'. I will add a separate section to show how pldmtool output with JSON format looks

Subheadings need more ##

Use something like this to see how it will render once merged. https://jbt.github.io/markdown-editor/
I tried with editor ## for subheadings looks decent enough size

This is not needed, pldmtool does not need libpldmresponder. There is no dependency with libpldmresponder.

https://github.com/openbmc/pldm/blob/master/pldmtool/meson.build#L23
OEM commands defined for IBM systems
i just copied this from tool output..
Is this hardcoded or read from a file? Please update once checking.
